trans-unit.source: Credential locker
trans-unit.target: Credential locker

trans-unit.source: This article describes how apps can use the Credential Locker to securely store and retrieve user credentials, and roam them between devices with the user's Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how apps can use the Credential Locker to securely store and retrieve user credentials, and roam them between devices with the user's Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: Fingerprint biometrics
trans-unit.target: Fingerprint biometrics

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to add fingerprint biometrics to your app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to add fingerprint biometrics to your app.

trans-unit.source: Including a request for fingerprint authentication when the user must consent to a particular action increases the security of your app.
trans-unit.target: Including a request for fingerprint authentication when the user must consent to a particular action increases the security of your app.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could require fingerprint authentication before authorizing an in-app purchase, or access to restricted resources.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could require fingerprint authentication before authorizing an in-app purchase, or access to restricted resources.

trans-unit.source: Fingerprint authentication is managed using the [UserConsentVerifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279134) class in the [Windows.Security.Credentials.UI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701356) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Fingerprint authentication is managed using the [UserConsentVerifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279134) class in the [Windows.Security.Credentials.UI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701356) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Share certificates between apps
trans-unit.target: Share certificates between apps

trans-unit.source: UWP apps that require secure authentication beyond a user Id and password combination can use certificates for authentication.
trans-unit.target: UWP apps that require secure authentication beyond a user Id and password combination can use certificates for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Certificate authentication provides a high level of trust when authenticating a user.
trans-unit.target: Certificate authentication provides a high level of trust when authenticating a user.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, a group of services will want to authenticate a user for multiple apps.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, a group of services will want to authenticate a user for multiple apps.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how you can authenticate multiple apps using the same certificate, and how you can provide convenient code for a user to import a certificate that was provided to access secured web services.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how you can authenticate multiple apps using the same certificate, and how you can provide convenient code for a user to import a certificate that was provided to access secured web services.

trans-unit.source: Web authentication broker
trans-unit.target: Web authentication broker

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to connect your app to an online identity provider that uses authentication protocols like OpenID or OAuth, such as Facebook, Twitter, Flickr, Instagram, and so on.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to connect your app to an online identity provider that uses authentication protocols like OpenID or OAuth, such as Facebook, Twitter, Flickr, Instagram, and so on.

trans-unit.source: The [AuthenticateAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br212066) method sends a request to the online identity provider and gets back an access token that describes the provider resources to which the app has access.
trans-unit.target: The [AuthenticateAsync](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br212066) method sends a request to the online identity provider and gets back an access token that describes the provider resources to which the app has access.

trans-unit.source: Intro to certificates
trans-unit.target: Intro to certificates

trans-unit.source: This article discusses the use of certificates in apps.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses the use of certificates in apps.

trans-unit.source: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.
trans-unit.target: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.

trans-unit.source: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.
trans-unit.target: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.

trans-unit.source: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.
trans-unit.target: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.

trans-unit.source: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.
trans-unit.target: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.

trans-unit.source: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
